Application.Application-Integration: Pertains to combining the application with other systems or platforms for enhanced functionality.

Application.Application-Plugin Management: Involves handling, updating, and configuring add-ons that extend the application's capabilities.

Application.Application-User Customization: Allows users to modify the application's settings or features according to their preferences.

Application.Application-App Configuration: Focuses on setting up initial application settings and adjusting features to meet specific needs.

Application.Application-Version Control: Deals with managing changes to application documents, programs, and other information stored as part of the development process.

Application.Application-Compatibility Checks: Ensures the application functions correctly across different devices, operating systems, or with other applications.

Application Performance Manager.Application Performance Manager-Performa: Tracks and analyzes the application performance to ensure it meets the desired standards.

Application Performance Manager.Application Performance Manager-Resource: Manages and optimizes the distribution of resources used by the application for efficient performance.

Application Performance Manager.Application Performance Manager-Traffic: Oversees and controls the flow of data within the application to prevent bottlenecks.

Application Performance Manager.Application Performance Manager-Diagnost: Provides utilities to analyze, diagnose, and resolve issues in application performance.

Big Data.Big Data-Data Processing: Handles the manipulation and transformation of large data sets for analysis and reporting.

Big Data.Big Data-Data Storage: Focuses on efficient storage solutions that manage large volumes of data.

Big Data.Big Data-Batch Processing: Involves processing data in large batches, allowing for efficient handling of large volumes of data.

Big Data.Big Data-Data Visualization: Transforms data into visual contexts, such as graphs or charts, to make data easier to understand and actionable.

Cloud.Cloud-Resource Management: Focuses on the efficient use of cloud resources to optimize cost and performance.

Cloud.Cloud-Virtualization: Involves creating virtual versions of devices and resources for scalability and efficiency.

Cloud.Cloud-Scalability Solutions: Pertains to strategies and technologies that enable cloud services to expand in capability without losing performance.

Cloud.Cloud-Cloud Security: Ensures the protection of data stored online from theft, leakage, and deletion.

Cloud.Cloud-Data Migration: Deals with moving data, applications, or other business elements to a cloud environment.

Cloud.Cloud-Service Configuration: Involves setting up cloud services according to specifications and requirements.

Computer Graphics.Computer Graphics-Image Rendering: Converts data from a model into a visual format that can be viewed as images or animations.

Computer Graphics.Computer Graphics-Animation: The process of creating the illusion of movement by displaying a series of pictures or frames.

Computer Graphics.Computer Graphics-Modeling: The creation of 3D objects within a scene.

Computer Graphics.Computer Graphics-Visual Effects: Techniques used in media to create imagined environments and characters.

Data Structure.Data Structure-Linear Structures: Manages data elements arranged in a linear sequence, such as arrays and lists.

Data Structure.Data Structure-Data Sorting: Involves arranging data into a defined order based on their attributes.

Data Structure.Data Structure-Search Algorithms: Methods used to locate specific data among a collection of data.

Data Structure.Data Structure-Data Manipulation: The process of changing data to make it more organized and easier to read.

Databases.Databases-Query Execution: Handles the process of executing queries to retrieve or manipulate data within a database.

Databases.Databases-Transaction Management: Manages database transactions to ensure data integrity and handle concurrent access.

Databases.Databases-Schema Design: Involves designing the structure of databases including tables, relationships, and data types.

Databases.Databases-Database Security: Focuses on protecting database content from unauthorized access or corruption.

Databases.Databases-Backup and Recovery: Deals with creating backups of data and restoring data from backups in case of data loss.

Databases.Databases-Database Optimization: Enhances the performance of the database by optimizing queries and indices.

Software Development and IT Operations.Software Development and IT Operations-C: Automates the merging and testing of code, helping to identify integration errors early.
Automatically deploys all code changes to a testing or production environment after the build stage.

Software Development and IT Operations.Software Development and IT Operations-A: Utilizes tools to automatically execute tests and report outcomes, improving software quality.

Software Development and IT Operations.Software Development and IT Operations-C: Manages the configuration of software and systems to maintain consistency across environments.

Software Development and IT Operations.Software Development and IT Operations-V: Tracks modifications to a set of files over time so that specific versions can be recalled later.

Software Development and IT Operations.Software Development and IT Operations-M: Involves tracking and logging the system's operational status to help diagnose faults and predict future issues.

Error Handling.Error Handling-Exception Handling: Involves techniques for catching and managing exceptions that occur during the execution of software.

Error Handling.Error Handling-Error Logging: Records errors and exceptions that occur during operation, allowing for later review and debugging.

Error Handling.Error Handling-Fault Tolerance: Enables a system to continue operating properly in the event of the failure of some of its components.

Error Handling.Error Handling-Debugging Tools: Tools and techniques used to identify, trace, and correct errors in software.

Error Handling.Error Handling-User Notification: Involves notifying users of errors or issues in a way that allows them to continue using the software effectively.

Error Handling.Error Handling-Error Prevention: Strategies and practices aimed at reducing the occurrence of errors within the software development process.

Event Handling.Event Handling-User Interactions: Manages how software responds to user inputs and actions.

Event Handling.Event Handling-System Events: Handles events generated by the system itself, such as startup, shutdown, and errors.

Event Handling.Event Handling-Event Logging: Records events that occur within the system, providing a history that can be analyzed for patterns or issues.

Event Handling.Event Handling-Event Driven Processing: A programming paradigm in which the flow of the program is determined by events such as user actions or sensor outputs.

Event Handling.Event Handling-Notifications: Mechanisms for alerting users or systems about important changes or updates.

Event Handling.Event Handling-Asynchronous Processing: Processing that does not block execution and allows a program to continue with other operations.

Logging.Logging-Event Logging: Records system or application events for monitoring and troubleshooting purposes.

Logging.Logging-Performance Tracking: Tracks various performance metrics to assess how well a system or application is functioning.

Machine Learning.Machine Learning-Training Models: Involves developing and training algorithms to perform tasks based on data.

Machine Learning.Machine Learning-Model Evaluation: Assesses the performance and accuracy of machine learning models.

Microservices/Services.Microservices/Services-Service Discovery: Enables services to find and communicate with each other without hard-coding service addresses.

Microservices/Services.Microservices/Services-Load Balancing: Distributes incoming service requests evenly across multiple service instances to optimize resource use and maximize throughput.

Multi-Thread.Multi-Thread-Resource Sharing: Involves managing how different threads or processes share and access common resources.
